intro: Lachnostachys verbascifolia, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, yellow flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its widespread distribution. Lachnostachys verbascifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
